Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2009 04:48AM bellavida wrote: My mom has been on Abraxane for almost a year and has done quite well on it. Initially she had some reduction in her liver mets and her most recent scan showed all is stable. Her doctor would like to see further reduction so in a couple of weeks she will be upping the dose. It has been a fairly doable drug for my mom, she has had fatigue but no neuropathy or other side affects. Hope that it goes well for you.
Posts.Title: Abraxane coming up AliceJean AliceJean

Posts.Content: bellavida wrote: My mom was diagnosed with metastisis to her pleura area last May and since that time has been stable while on Femara. However, today we received her latest scan results and the news is not good. She has new cells in her kidney as well as a couple 2-3cm growths in her liver. Her doctor is planning to start her on Taxol starting Tuesday, she will receive treatment once a week for three weeks and then her doctor plans to reevaluate. Her doctor seems optimistic, but I am devastated. Has anyone been on Taxol? What should she expect? I would appreciate any advice, thank you! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2008 08:08PM bellavida wrote: I did student loan discharges for two years for a non-profit law center as a legal assistant. Disability discharges have been made more complicated in the last several years. Before they would just discharge the loan but now loans are conditionally discharged and then after a couple of years once they determine that your disability is indeed permanent and you are still disabled they permanately discharge them. My father's loans were discharged a couple of years back due to disability  (he has Parkinsons's) but it took a couple of years. As far as forebearance and interest I believe it depends on what type of loan you have. If you have a unsubsidized loan interest continues to acrue however if you have a subsidized loan it does not. I hope this helps.  Christina
Posts.Title: Perm Diability & Student Loans TripleNeg burns_la

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 01:22PM bellavida wrote: My mom has lost about 20 pounds over the last year and after her most recent plural effusion and hospitalization her doctor placed her on a high protein diet. Practically everything she eats has protein in it. She also is drinking a B*oost Plus everyday. She also takes megace everyday to increase her appetite. That along with the diet seems to be working and she has recently gained about 6 pounds, but it has been a slow process. I have often read your posts and you are truly a model of grace and strength. God bless!
